Translations.Text: Expand We not thy breast
and lifted from thee the heavy loaded burden
that weighed heavily on thy back
Exalted We not thy remembrance
So, truly, with hardship, ease
Truly, with hardship, ease
When thou hadst finished thy duties, then, work on supplication
and quest thy Lord
By the fig and the olive
and by Mount Sinai
and by this trustworthy land
truly, We have created the human being of the fairer symmetry
Again, We returned him to the lowest of the low
But those who believed and did as the ones in accord with morality, for them is compensation, that which is unfailing
What will cause thee to deny the Judgment after that
Is not God The Most Just of ones who judge
Recite in the Name of thy Lord Who created
He created the human being from a clot
Recite: Thy Lord is the Most Generous
He Who taught by the pen
He taught the human being what he knows not
No indeed! The human being is, truly, defiant
He considered himself self-sufficient
Truly, to thy Lord is the returning
Hast thou thyself considered he who prohibits
a servant when he invoked blessings
Hast thou considered if he had been on guidance
or commanded God-consciousness
Hast thou considered if he denied and turned away
Knows he not that God sees
No indeed! Truly, if he refrains himself not, We will, surely, lay hold of him by the forelock
a lying, inequitable forelock
And let him call to his conclave
We will call to the guards of hell
No indeed! Truly, obey thou him not but prostrate thyself to God and be near to Him.‡
Truly, We caused it to descend on the night of power
And what will cause thee to recognize what is the night of power
The night of power is better than a thousand months
The angels come forth and the Spirit during it with their Lord’s permission, with every command
Peace it is until the time of the rising dawn
Not would those who were ungrateful from among the People of the Book, nor the ones who are polytheists to be ones who set aside their beliefs until the clear portent approaches them
A Messenger from God, who recounts to them purified scrolls
wherein are truth-loving Books
Split up not among themselves those to whom the Book was given until after the clear portent drew near them

They were commanded but to worship God as ones who are sincere and devoted in the way of life to Him, as monotheists and they perform the formal prayer and they give the purifying alms. That is the truth-loving way of life
Truly, those who were ungrateful among the People of the Book and the ones who are polytheists will be in the fire of hell, ones who will dwell in it forever. Those are the worst of creatures
But those who believed and did as the ones in accord with morality, those are the best of creatures

Their recompense is with their Lord—Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers run, ones who will dwell in them forever, eternally. God was well-pleased with them and they were well-pleased with Him. That is for him who dreaded his Lord
When the earth will be convulsed with a convulsion
and the earth brought out its ladings
and the human being said: What is with it
On that Day it will divulge its news
for your Lord revealed it
On that Day humanity will issue, separately, that they may be caused to see their actions
And whoever does the weight of an atom of good will see it
And whoever does the weight of an atom of the worst will see it
By the chargers, panting
by ones who strike a fire, striking fire
by the ones who are raiders in the morning
then, they plowed it to a trail of dust
and they penetrated the center with it, a multitude
Truly, the human being is unthankful to his Lord
And, truly, he is a witness to that
And he is more severe in the cherishing of good
